docs.snippet: IN addition to speeding German rearmament in Europe, the State Department is also busy in this country these days trying to restore 32,000 German soldiers to home soil. These troops have been mysteriously missing for ten years, but State was recently...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN addition to speeding German rearmament in Europe, the State Department is also busy in this country these days trying to restore 32,000 German soldiers to home soil. These troops have been mysteriously missing for ten years, but State was recently able to locate 423 of them in Texas.
docs.abstract: Mil toys, taken from Hersbruck Museum under denazification program and recently found, described; to be returned by US

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 3 -- The anti-colonial powers scored another victory in the United Nations today when the General Assembly placed the question of West New Guinea on its agenda. The vote was 31 to 18, and the United States was among the...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 3 -- The anti-colonial powers scored another victory in the United Nations today when the General Assembly placed the question of West New Guinea on its agenda. The vote was 31 to 18, and the United States was among the ten members that abstained.

headline.main: COLONIALISM FOES WIN AGAIN IN U. N. ON AGENDA ISSUE; Dutch Protest Loses in 31-18 Assembly Vote to Take Up West New Guinea FRENCH PLACES VACANT But Delegates Believe Envoy Will Return if Security Council Is Called COLONIALISM FOES WIN AGAIN IN U. N.

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 -- Provisional President Eduardo Lonardi dismissed Argentina's Supreme Court and Attorney General today. In a brief decree noting that the re-establishment of judicial order is one of the country's most urgent needs, General...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 -- Provisional President Eduardo Lonardi dismissed Argentina's Supreme Court and Attorney General today. In a brief decree noting that the re-establishment of judicial order is one of the country's most urgent needs, General Lonardi said his Government "assumed before history and the nation the responsibility" for ordering the dissolution of the nation's highest court.

headline.main: Peronist Supreme Court Is Dissolved by Lonardi; ARGENTINA DROPS PERON HIGH COURT

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 6 -- Argentina's campaign to force Juan D. Peron off the American continent came into the open today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 6 -- Argentina's campaign to force Juan D. Peron off the American continent came into the open today.
docs.abstract: Argentina warns Paraguay that prolonged Peron stay may harm ties; holds his pol remarks 'grave violation' of Paraguay's obligations; seeks to force Peron off Amer continent; dies views an exiles activities

headline.main: PARAGUAY URGED TO SEND PERON ON; His Stay Would Peril Nation's Relations With Argentina, Lonardi Regime Warns

docs.snippet: RICHMOND, Calif., Oct. 7 (UP) -- Mary Lena Faulk of Thomasville, Ga., the former national amateur champion, took the first-round lead in the $5,000 Richmond women's open golf tournament today. She fired a 74, two over men's par, on the Richmond Golf...
docs.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Calif., Oct. 7 (UP) -- Mary Lena Faulk of Thomasville, Ga., the former national amateur champion, took the first-round lead in the $5,000 Richmond women's open golf tournament today. She fired a 74, two over men's par, on the Richmond Golf Club course.

headline.main: MARY FAULK'S 74 TAKES GOLF LEAD; Georgia Pro a Shot Ahead of Miss Suggs in Richmond Open -- Patty Berg at 80

docs.snippet: A man who has saved dollars by ignoring pennies finds his business growing so big he has had to hire an electronic brain to keep track of the money.

docs.snippet: Jose A. Mora, Uruguay's Ambassador to the United States, was honored here yesterday for his role as president of the Council of the Organization of American States in ending a conflict in Costa Rica.
